intro: Mollugo pauli-wilhelmi, commonly known as the mossy spurge, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and North Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky crevices. It produces tiny, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous minute seeds. Mollugo pauli-wilhelmi is often found in areas with high humidity and is adapted to nutrient-poor soils.
